name: AI Fundamentals
description: Core concepts and terminology that form the foundation of artificial intelligence, including types of AI, general definitions, and historical context.

name: Machine Learning Algorithms
description: Traditional machine learning techniques such as classification, regression, clustering, and reinforcement learning — typically involving structured data and statistical models.

name: Deep Learning Architectures
description: Neural network-based models with multiple layers, designed to process complex patterns in high-dimensional data like images, audio, and text.

name: Prompt Engineering
description: Techniques for designing and optimizing input prompts to guide large language models (LLMs) and other generative AI systems in producing desired outputs.

name: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
description: Techniques and models focused on understanding, processing, and generating human language — including tasks like tokenization, summarization, and translation.

name: Generative AI
description: Models and techniques that generate content — such as text, images, or code — using foundational models like LLMs and diffusion models, often through prompt-driven interaction.

name: AI Agents & Autonomy
description: Autonomous systems capable of decision-making, interacting with tools or environments, and performing complex workflows with minimal human input.

name: Knowledge & Retrieval Systems
description: Structures and techniques for representing, retrieving, and reasoning over information — including knowledge graphs, vector search, and RAG (retrieval-augmented generation).

name: Data Engineering for AI
description: Processes and practices involved in preparing, enriching, and managing data for AI workloads — including labeling, feature extraction, and real-time transformations.

name: Model Deployment & Operations
description: Techniques and tools for putting models into production, monitoring their performance, handling drift, scaling inference, and maintaining reliable AI services (MLOps, LLMOps).

name: AI Infrastructure & Ecosystem
description: The tools, frameworks, platforms, and systems that support building and running AI applications — including APIs, SDKs, orchestration layers, and cloud services.

name: Ethics & Governance
description: Concerns and principles related to fairness, accountability, explainability, bias mitigation, compliance with regulations, and responsible AI development.

name: Applied AI Domains
description: Use-case-specific applications of AI across industries such as healthcare, finance, manufacturing, and logistics — including domain terms and sector-specific techniques.
